    • Method Detail

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric​(@NotNull
                                @NotNull java.lang.String string)

        Checks if the String contains only unicode digits. A decimal point is not a unicode digit and returns false.

        null will return false. An empty String (length()=0) will return true. 

         NumberUtil.isNumeric(null)   = false
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("")     = true
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("  ")   = false
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("123")  = true
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("12 3") = false
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("ab2c") = false
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("12-3") = false
 NumberUtil.isNumeric("12.3") = false

        Returns true if only contains digits, and is non-null

        Parameters:
        string - the String to check, may be null
        Returns:
        Boolean

                                             @NotNull java.lang.Boolean string)

        Parameters:

        total - The total

        Deprecated.

        Get a random number within a range

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Parameters:
